value.0:
Book of Woodworking

Armor and/or Weapon Crafting Skill (DC Varies by Recipe)

- Woodworking  will help you stay alive. It can also make you a substantial amount of gold if you are diligent about your business.
- To Find Wood you have to Prospect for it. When you think you have found a harvestable tree, Open the ORM and choose the Prospecting option. If you have enough Lore Skill you will indentify all Trees within 5 Meters.


Harvesting Wood:
Once you have identified a Tree you will have to put your back to work. There are 3 types of trees Ironwood(Rare), Oak, and Elm (both are abundant).

Each tree has a damage requirement that continues to add with every stroke you hit it. Overcome this requirement and you will receive a chunk of wood. While using the Woodman's Axe (large one) you will gain an additional chunk of wood 50% of the time.

You will need the right tool for the job. There are two weapons...Woodman's Axe...and Light Wood Axe. Available at a general supply store. These will break every so often.

It would be recommendable to get yourself a Pack Animal to help carry your heavy burdens.


Milling Wood:
Once you have gathered wood...place the wood on the Woodworking Table. There is a specific amount of wood required to make planks.

There is also a maximum capacity of wood that the table can handle. Just plop the wood on and it will tell you if you have to much...nice. If you have enough skill from your Armor or Weapon skill points plus a d20 Roll you will succeed at milling the wood.

NOTE: The Woodworking Table will stay locked for 10 Seconds.


How to Craft Items (Including the DC and Cost):

First thing you need is the Crafting Stump. Just step up to it (there is a black spot) then right click on the whatever you are trying to craft. You will see the options available on each and every item activated. There is also a cost for each item crafted because of consumables you don't have to worry about. The Crafting Stump is only for wood objects BUT any item can be crafted here....even the metal ones.

The Base Items you need (For the creation of metal items see the Book of Smithing):

Materials:
Ironwood Planks
Plank of Oak
Plank of Elm

Base Component/DC/Cost:
Elmwood Bow Shaft/14/5 - A nice flexible wood for a bow.
Feathers(None) - A bunch of feathers used to create arrows and crossbow bolts.
Oaken Crossbow Shelf/14/10 - This is the basic component crafter's can use to build various types of crossbows.
Oaken Pole/12/2 - This pole made from sturdy oakwood can be used as component for many types of weapons with the craft weapon skill.
Oaken Shield Body/12/3 - The base component for most types of shield, except for tower shields.
Oaken Weapon Grip/12/2 - Made from sturdy oakwood this crafting component can be used to assemble many different types of martial weapons.
Projectile Shaft/11/1 - This is the base components that, when combined with feathers, can be used to craft projectiles such as arrows and bolts.

The Recipes:

Shield/DC/Cost:
Large Shield/13/25 - Oaken Shield Body/Iron Bands
Large Shield, Ironwood/22/5,100  - Ironwood Planks
Small Shield/11/4 - Oaken Shield Body/Iron Bands
Small Shield, Ironwood/21/5,200 - Ironwood Planks
Tower Shield, Ironwood/21/5,000 - Ironwood Planks

Weapons/DC/Cost

Poles:
Club/10/1 - Oaken Pole/Iron Bands
Club/11/1 - Plank of Elm Wood
Club/10/2 - Plank of Oakwood
Club, Ironwood/15/650 - Ironwood Planks

Bows and Crossbows:
Crossbow, Light/15/35 - Crossbow Shelf/Leather Strings
Crossbow, Heavy/17/50 - Crossbow Shelf/Leather Strings
Longbow/15/75 - Elmwood Bow Shaft/Leather Strings
Quarterstaff/10/1 - Oaken Pole/Iron Bands
Quarterstaff, Ironwood/15/650 - Ironwood Planks
Shortbow/13/10 - Elmwood Bow Shaft/Leather Strings
Whip/17/20 - Oaken Weapon Grip/Leather Strings

Projectiles:
Arrows (x20)/13/1 - Projectile Shaft/Feathers
Bolts (x20)/13/1 - Projectile Shaft/Feathers
